article.headline: Sam Houston St. 73, Texas-Arlington 57
article.story: HUNTSVILLE, Texas (AP) -- Shamir McDaniel's 18 points helped Sam Houston State outlast Texas-Arlington 73-57 Wednesday night. McDaniel led four players in double figures for the Bearkats (16-3, 4-2 Southland). Ryan Bright scored 14 points and was the game-high rebounder with 17. Reggie Rawlins scored 16 points and Jeremy Thomas added 11 for Sam Houston. Texas-Arlington (14-5, 4-3) were led by Anthony Vereen's 22 points. He was the only player in double figures for the Mavericks. Texas-Arlington jumped out to a 17-6 lead, but Sam Houston State scored the next 13 points. After four more lead changes, Ryan Bright's 3-pointer with 3:52 left in the first half gave the Bearkats a 27-25 advantage and the lead for good. Texas-Arlington was without starting forward Larry Posey, who made the trip but did not play because of an undisclosed illness. The Mavericks hit only two of 15 3-pointers, while the Bearkats were 8-of-26 from behind the arc. The loss snapped a four-game win streak for the Mavericks.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
